AudioDeviceStart(_:_:) FunctionAudioDeviceStart(_:_:)iOS 2.0+iPadOS 2.0+Mac Catalyst 13.1+macOS 10.0+func AudioDeviceStart(
    _ inDevice: AudioObjectID,
    _ inProcID: AudioDeviceIOProcID?
) -> OSStatus Parameters inDeviceThe AudioDevice to start the IOProc on.

The AudioDeviceIOProcID to start. Note that this can be NULL, which starts the hardware regardless of whether or not there are any IOProcs registered. This is necessary if any of the AudioDevice’s timing services are to be used. A balancing call to AudioDeviceStop with a NULL IOProc is required to stop the hardware.

An OSStatus indicating success or failure.

# AudioDeviceStart(_:_:) | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Core Audio ](/documentation/coreaudio)

- [ AudioDeviceStart(_:_:) ](/documentation/coreaudio/audiodevicestart(_:_:))

-  AudioDeviceStart(_:_:) 

Function# AudioDeviceStart(_:_:)

iOS 2.0+iPadOS 2.0+Mac Catalyst 13.1+macOS 10.0+

```
func AudioDeviceStart(
    _ inDevice: AudioObjectID,
    _ inProcID: AudioDeviceIOProcID?
) -> OSStatus
```

## [ Parameters ](/documentation/coreaudio/audiodevicestart(_:_:)#parameters)

`inDevice`The AudioDevice to start the IOProc on.

`inProcID`The AudioDeviceIOProcID to start. Note that this can be NULL, which starts the hardware regardless of whether or not there are any IOProcs registered. This is necessary if any of the AudioDevice’s timing services are to be used. A balancing call to AudioDeviceStop with a NULL IOProc is required to stop the hardware.

## [Return Value](/documentation/coreaudio/audiodevicestart(_:_:)#return-value)

An OSStatus indicating success or failure.

## [Discussion](/documentation/coreaudio/audiodevicestart(_:_:)#discussion)

Starts IO for the given AudioDeviceIOProcID.

## [See Also](/documentation/coreaudio/audiodevicestart(_:_:)#see-also)
